document_data.name: Bitter Black
document_data.mainbody: '''Bitter Black''' was a stout beer exported from [[Arabel]] and sold through [[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]].
document_data.Description: This heavy beer tasted best when served at cellar temperatures. Arabellans looked down upon anyone drinking it at a different temperature. Bitter Black had a dark black color with a thick head of deep brown foam.
document_data.Availability:
* [[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-univere)|Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]] sold Bitter Black in a variety of containers:
** Hand keg (3 [[sp]])
** Cask (2 [[gp]])
** Barrel (5 gp)
** [[Butt]] (15 gp)
** [[Tun]] (30 gp)
** The [[High Helm]] inn and festhall in [[Juniril]] village of [[Cormyr]] and [[Twelve Dancing Knights]] tavern in [[Greatgaunt]] listed Bitter Black among their regular libations.
* The [[Candlekeep Inn]] had Bitter Black on its drinks menu, charging 1 [[silver piece]] per pint.<ref>{{Cite dragon/255/Baldur's Gate: Candlekeep|57}}
* The [[Silver Taproom]] in [[Essembra]] served Bitter Black for a single silver coin.
* The [[Nashkel Inn]] in [[Amn]] and the [[Friendly Arm]] on the Sword Coast served imported Bitter Black for a single [[gold]] coin.
* Bitter Black was available from the [[Den of the Seven Vales]] inn and the [[Mithrest]] in the [[Athkatla/Guards District|Guards District]] of [[Athkatla]].
* Bitter Black traveled as far north as the [[Ten-Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]]. It was sold at [[The Salty Dog]] tavern in [[Targos]] in [[1312 DR]].
